events.info: Born on 15th June 1920 in Pogranicze, Chelm district, Lublin province, Poland, to parents Jehide and Elke (n√©e Szwarc) Warzager.
Completed school and attended cheder in Chelm for six months before returning home to assist his family.
Began working at a concrete factory owned by relatives in Udalec, near Chelm, producing roof tiles and other concrete products.
Conscripted into the Soviet Army during World War II; served on various fronts, including near Leningrad (now St. Petersburg).
Wounded during an offensive near Leningrad; sustained injuries to his arm and leg, leading to a six-month hospitalization.
Repatriated to Poland and settled in Legnica; initially worked in a tank repair factory operated by the Russians.
Began a 22-year tenure as a locksmith at the Legnica Clothing Factory (ELPO); also served in the factory's fire brigade.
Legally changed his first name from Icek to Michal as part of post-war assimilation.
Actively involved in the Union of War Invalids; served as a financial aid and loan officer, assisting fellow veterans.
At age 84, continued to reside in Legnica, contributing to the local Jewish community's weekly Sabbath observances.
